gov.usgs.locator

Class Wresidual

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.locator.Wresidual
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Wresidual>

    public class Wresidual
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Wresidual>
    This weighted residuals storage combines the residuals and weights for picks and the Bayesian depth, while providing storage for the dispersion calculation and the spatial derivatives. Note that the residuals and weights are kept separate as some calculations depend only on the residuals.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wresidual

        public Wresidual()
        Create the object with no initial information.

      • Wresidual

        public Wresidual(Pick pick,
                 double residual,
                 double weight,
                 boolean isDepth,
                 double dTdLat,
                 double dTdLon,
                 double dTdDepth)
        Initialize the weighted residual.
        Parameters:
        pick - The pick associated with this data, if any
        residual - Residual in seconds for picks and in kilometers for depth
        weight - Weight
        isDepth - True if this is the Bayesian depth residual
        dTdLat - Derivative of travel time with respect to latitude in seconds/kilometers
        dTdLon - Derivative of travel time with respect to longitude in seconds/kilometers
        dTdDepth - Derivative of travel time with respect to depth in seconds/kilometers

                   double residual,
                   double weight,
                   boolean isDepth,
                   double dTdLat,
                   double dTdLon,
                   double dTdDepth)
        Re-initialize the weighted residual.
        Parameters:
        pick - The pick associated with this data, if any
        residual - Residual in seconds for picks and in kilometers for depth
        weight - Weight
        isDepth - True if this is the Bayesian depth residual
        dTdLat - Derivative of travel time with respect to latitude in seconds/kilometers
        dTdLon - Derivative of travel time with respect to longitude in seconds/kilometers
        dTdDepth - Derivative of travel time with respect to depth in seconds/kilometers

      • deMedianRes

        public void deMedianRes(double median)
        Remove the median from the travel-time residuals.
        Parameters:
        median - Median travel-time residual in seconds

      • deMedianDeriv

        public void deMedianDeriv(double[] medians)
        Remove the median from the derivatives. Note that this isn't the median of the derivatives, but the derivative corresponding to the median of the residuals.
        Parameters:
        medians - Array of derivative medians

      • updateEst

        public void updateEst(double[] trialVector)
        Update the estimated residual given a trial step vector.
        Parameters:
        trialVector - Distance and direction from the current hypocenter in kilometers

      • deMedianEst

        public void deMedianEst(double median)
        Remove the median from the estimated travel-time residuals.
        Parameters:
        median - Median estimated travel-time residuals in seconds

      • sortRes

        public void sortRes()
        Set the sort value to sort by travel-time residual. Note that the depth residual will be sorted to the end to keep it out of the way.

      • sortSpread

        public void sortSpread(double median)
        Set the sort value to sort by absolute demedianed travel-time residuals in order to compute the spread, a 1-norm measure of scatter. Note that the depth residual will be sorted to the end to keep it out of the way.
        Parameters:
        median - Median travel-time residual in seconds

      • sortDisp

        public void sortDisp(double median)
        Set the sort value to sort by the demedianed, weighted residuals in order to compute the R-estimator dispersion or penalty function.
        Parameters:
        median - Median travel-time residual in seconds

      • sortEst

        public void sortEst()
        Set the sort value to sort by the estimated travel-time residual. Note that the depth residual will be sorted to the end to keep it out of the way.

      • sortEstDisp

        public void sortEstDisp(double median)
        Set the sort value to sort by the demedianed, weighted, estimated residuals in order to compute the R-estimator dispersion or penalty function.
        Parameters:
        median - Median estimated travel-time residual in seconds

        Contribute to projecting the original weighted residuals.
        Parameters:

        v - Eigenvector element

        public void changeSign()

        Returns:
        Correlation between the horizontal derivatives of two picks
